intro: Valerianella platyloba, commonly known as broad-leaved valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in temperate climates. Valerianella platyloba is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its calming effects.
